title: Lady health worker shot dead in Mirali
text:
NORTH WAZIRISTAN: A lady health worker was shot dead by some unidentified attackers in an incident of targeted killing in Mirali sub-division of North Waziris­tan tribal district on Monday.

Naheed Gul, 25, daughter of Farooq Khan, was returning home after performing her duty at the Basic Health Unit of Nathasi in the Khus­hali Toorikhel area of Mirali.

Officials said that the gunmen forcibly disembarked Ms Gul from a rickshaw, took her to a deserted place and shot in the head, leaving her dead on the spot. The body was brought to tehsil headquarters hospital in Mirali Town.

Officials said that Ms Gul was posted as nutritionist at the BHU, Nathasi. The incident took place at a time when the health department has launched a polio vaccination drive across Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

This was the second incident of targeted killing of a woman in the area. Earlier, a local woman was killed in Mirali about three weeks ago. The woman was a housewife.

Published in Dawn, September 22nd, 2020
summary:
NORTH WAZIRISTAN: A lady health worker was shot dead by some unidentified attackers in an incident of targeted killing in Mirali sub-division of North Waziris­tan tribal district on Monday.
Naheed Gul, 25, daughter of Farooq Khan, was returning home after performing her duty at the Basic Health Unit of Nathasi in the Khus­hali Toorikhel area of Mirali.
Officials said that the gunmen forcibly disembarked Ms Gul from a rickshaw, took her to a deserted place and shot in the head, leaving her dead on the spot.
The incident took place at a time when the health department has launched a polio vaccination drive across Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
This was the second incident of targeted killing of a woman in the area.

title: Teenage girl allegedly raped by stepfather in Gujranwala
text:
GUJRANWALA: A 40-year-old man allegedly raped his 17-year-old stepdaughter in Gujranwala’s Pasban Colony, ARY News reported on Sunday.

According to the police, the teenage girl in her statement to police has alleged that her stepfather, Gulzar, had raped her several times. A case has been registered against the suspect on a victim’s complaint.

Meanwhile, police have arrested accused and started investigation. He will be interrogated further after the medical reports of victim, said police.

The 17-year-old girl has been shifted to hospital for medical examination.

In another recent incident, a girl was allegedly gang-raped by three people in Bahawalpur district of the Punjab province as she was returning after attending a marriage ceremony.

The victim, a resident of Chak 7 BC in Bahawalpur, claimed in a complaint filed with the local police that she was on her way home after attending a marriage ceremony when the accused abducted her.

“Three people raped me and further threatened to kill me on informing police regarding the incident,” the girl said.

It is pertinent to mention here that horrific incidents of sexual abuse have been reported from parts of the country after two major incidents of the Marwah rape and murder case in Karachi and the gang rape of a woman at Lahore motorway shock the entire Pakistan.

Comments

comments
summary:
GUJRANWALA: A 40-year-old man allegedly raped his 17-year-old stepdaughter in Gujranwala’s Pasban Colony, ARY News reported on Sunday.
According to the police, the teenage girl in her statement to police has alleged that her stepfather, Gulzar, had raped her several times.
The 17-year-old girl has been shifted to hospital for medical examination.
In another recent incident, a girl was allegedly gang-raped by three people in Bahawalpur district of the Punjab province as she was returning after attending a marriage ceremony.
“Three people raped me and further threatened to kill me on informing police regarding the incident,” the girl said.

title: Child sexually assaulted
text:
RAWALPINDI: A four year old was allegedly sexually abused by a man in Rawat, who the police have apprehended after an FIR was registered on Sunday.

The victim’s mother told police that she left her home for work with her daughter and left her 10-year-old and four-year-old sons at home.

She said her four-year-old son was abused by a man at her neighbour’s house, who then fled.

A medical examination of the victim led to the registration of an FIR and the subsequent arrest of a suspect, who police said will be produced in court for remand custody.

Published in Dawn, November 9th, 2020
authors: ["The Newspaper'S Staff Reporter", 'Maliha Rehman', 'Images Staff', 'Maleeha Lodhi']

title: Girl gang-raped after attending marriage ceremony in Bahawalpur
text:
Girl gang-raped after attending marriage ceremony in Bahawalpur

BAHAWALPUR: A girl was allegedly gang-raped by three people while returning home after attending a marriage ceremony in Bahawalpur.

The girl in her complaint said that she was on her way home on Sunday night after attending a marriage ceremony when she was abducted by the accused.

A resident of Chak 7 BC in Bahawalpur, the girl claimed that she was sexually assaulted by three people and threatened to kill her on informing police regarding the incident.

Read more: Minor girl raped in Rawalpindi, suspect arrested

The police while conforming the report filed with them said that they had shifted the victim to a hospital for medical examination. In another recent incident, a 12-year-old girl was sexually assaulted within the jurisdiction of Gujranwala’s Sabzi Mandi police station.

According to details, the accused identified as 22-year-old Gul Sher was arrested after the victim’s father caught him red-handed while rescuing his daughter. The victim was later shifted to a hospital in a critical condition.
summary:
Girl gang-raped after attending marriage ceremony in BahawalpurBAHAWALPUR: A girl was allegedly gang-raped by three people while returning home after attending a marriage ceremony in Bahawalpur.
The girl in her complaint said that she was on her way home on Sunday night after attending a marriage ceremony when she was abducted by the accused.
A resident of Chak 7 BC in Bahawalpur, the girl claimed that she was sexually assaulted by three people and threatened to kill her on informing police regarding the incident.
In another recent incident, a 12-year-old girl was sexually assaulted within the jurisdiction of Gujranwala’s Sabzi Mandi police station.
The victim was later shifted to a hospital in a critical condition.

title: Minor boy sexually assaulted in Swabi village
text:
SWABI: A man sexually assaulted a seven-year-old boy in Parmuli village of Razaar tehsil here on Monday.

Parmuli police station officials said the accused took the boy to an abandoned plot when he was returning from school and assaulted him.

The boy’s father got an FIR registered, stating that they belonged to Gujjar families living in Mardan, but were presently residing in Parmuli area of Swabi.

The child told the police that Ikram Khan forcibly took him to nearby thick bushes where he sexually assaulted him.

The accused, also belongs to Mardan, but is presently living in Parmuli village.

The child’s father said when he came back home his condition was unstable. On inquiry, he narrated the entire story to them. When contacted, Parmuli SHO Fawad Khan said soon after registration of the case they raided the house of the accused and arrested him.

In the initial investigation, he said the accused confessed to the crime. He said medical report of the boy was still awaited.

Meanwhile, the police tracked down a gang of motorcycle thieves and arrested three Afghan refugees, and recovered three stolen motorcycles from them.

Also, four people were injured when a rickshaw crashed against a roadside tree on Monday.

Published in Dawn, October 27th, 2020
summary:
SWABI: A man sexually assaulted a seven-year-old boy in Parmuli village of Razaar tehsil here on Monday.
Parmuli police station officials said the accused took the boy to an abandoned plot when he was returning from school and assaulted him.
The boy’s father got an FIR registered, stating that they belonged to Gujjar families living in Mardan, but were presently residing in Parmuli area of Swabi.
The child told the police that Ikram Khan forcibly took him to nearby thick bushes where he sexually assaulted him.
The accused, also belongs to Mardan, but is presently living in Parmuli village.

title: Maid found dead at employer’s house
text:
LAHORE: A teenage housemaid was found dead under mysterious circumstances in the house of her employer in the South Cantt area here on Thursday.

The 16-year-old girl was working at the house of Awais for the last some months, a police official said. He added that Awais contacted the girl’s parents and told them that she was electrocuted.

The official said the parents of the deceased reached the site, alerted the police and declared the assertion of the employer doubtful. They alleged that she had been killed by the landlord as he used to torture her on petty mistakes.

Police shifted the body to the morgue for autopsy to confirm the cause of death.

Published in Dawn, October 16th, 2020
authors: ["The Newspaper'S Staff Reporter", 'Maliha Rehman', 'Images Staff', 'Maleeha Lodhi']
summary:
LAHORE: A teenage housemaid was found dead under mysterious circumstances in the house of her employer in the South Cantt area here on Thursday.
The 16-year-old girl was working at the house of Awais for the last some months, a police official said.
He added that Awais contacted the girl’s parents and told them that she was electrocuted.
The official said the parents of the deceased reached the site, alerted the police and declared the assertion of the employer doubtful.
They alleged that she had been killed by the landlord as he used to torture her on petty mistakes.

title: Khairpur man shoots wife dead during argument
text:
A man shot and killed his wife in Rajpari village near Khairpur district’s Kot Diji on Wednesday.

He was identified as Shoukat Hussain Shah. The police are looking for him.

The couple was reportedly arguing when Hussain shot his wife, Rehana Shah, 22, with his pistol.

Khairpur SSP Ameer Saud Masi said a police team raided the village and seized the murder weapon. Rehana’s body was shifted to Kot Diji hospital for a postmortem.

No FIR was registered till the this story was filed.

This is the second case of violence against women being reported from Khairpur in the last 24 hours. On Tuesday, two men raped a 13-year-old girl near Kot Diji.

The survivor and her parents told the media that the rapists were from their own community. The survivor said they took her to a deserted place and raped her.

Two months ago, another rape case was reported from Khairpur. A tutor was charged for raping three students, including a sixth-grader, at his house.

The Sindh police had taken action against the suspect after the incident went viral of multiple social media platforms. Rights activists and journalists called for his immediate arrest after his photos went viral.
summary:
A man shot and killed his wife in Rajpari village near Khairpur district’s Kot Diji on Wednesday.
The couple was reportedly arguing when Hussain shot his wife, Rehana Shah, 22, with his pistol.
This is the second case of violence against women being reported from Khairpur in the last 24 hours.
The Sindh police had taken action against the suspect after the incident went viral of multiple social media platforms.
Rights activists and journalists called for his immediate arrest after his photos went viral.

title: Eight raped in parts of Punjab
text:
OKARA: Eight people, three minor boys among them, were allegedly raped in parts of Punjab during the last few days.

Six of the ghastly incidents were reported in various parts of Okara. Two minor boys were raped at 47/GD and Chishti Qutab Din villages and one at Shergarh Town. Police registered cases of these incidents.

A woman was gang-raped in an area in the Shahbore police station jurisdiction. She escaped the perpetrators after five months and police registered a case.

A girl was raped at 1/1AL village and police registered a case. A police team arrested one of the rapists of a girl at Lai Fazal Shah village.

CHINIOT: A woman was gang -raped for three days after she was abducted at Aminpur Town.

‘R’, a resident of Chak No 142 JB, went to Aminpur Town for shopping and a man abducted her and raped her at a deserted house.

The suspect later handed over the woman to his friend who and his brother also sexually assaulted her.

The Rajoa police have registered a case under section 376 of PPC and arrested the three suspects.

SIALKOT: A 14-year-old girl was gang-raped at her house at Thro Mandi village of Pasrur tehsil on Thursday.

According to police, the girl was alone at her home when two armed suspects forced their entry there, raped her at gunpoint and fled away, leaving her injured. The girl was admitted to Pasrur’s Tehsil Headquarters Hospital in critical condition.

Phalora police registered a case against the two nominated suspects but none of them could be arrested so far.

Published in Dawn, September 25th, 2020
summary:
OKARA: Eight people, three minor boys among them, were allegedly raped in parts of Punjab during the last few days.
Two minor boys were raped at 47/GD and Chishti Qutab Din villages and one at Shergarh Town.
A girl was raped at 1/1AL village and police registered a case.
CHINIOT: A woman was gang -raped for three days after she was abducted at Aminpur Town.
Phalora police registered a case against the two nominated suspects but none of them could be arrested so far.

title: Two held for harassing foreign women
text:
The Islamabad police have arrested two suspects for allegedly harassing three foreign women, who had lost way while hiking in Sanyari forest.

The suspects identified as Furqan and Abrar had allegedly harassed the three women, who were from Turkey, Italy and Norway.

The Islamabad police had formed special teams to arrest suspects involved in harassing three foreigners near Sanyari village in the precincts of Kohsar police station. Operations DIG Waqaruddin Syed had ordered City SP to book the offenders at the earliest.

The women had told the police that they had gone for hiking in the Sanyari forest and strayed. Some three suspects reached there and harassed them. However, they fled after the women resisted and started screaming for help.

The police reached the forest as early as it received the complaint and found the girls.

Islamabad police officials said that the police teams were conducting raids in the area to find other suspects and assured that they would be arrested soon.

Separately, Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) of Islamabad Police have busted five members of a dacoit gang and recovered mobile phone and weapon from their possession.

A police spokesman on Saturday said, Investigation SP Malik Naeem Iqbal constituted a team under the supervision of CIA DSP Hakim Khan, including Sub-Inspector, Zafer Iqbal ASIs Safder, Sadeer along with other officials which successfully busted the gang involved in snatching valuables at gun point.

They were identified as Shahid Gujjar, Anar Gul, Qadeem Shah, Irfan and Zahid Khan.

Police team also recovered mobile phone, three 30 bore pistols along with ammunition and others dacoity tools from their possession.

During the preliminary investigation, they confessed to their involvement in incidents of looting people in various areas of Islamabad. Separate cases have been registered in Sabzi Mandi police stations against the nabbed persons and further investigation is underway.

Published in The Express Tribune, November 8th, 2020.
summary:
The Islamabad police have arrested two suspects for allegedly harassing three foreign women, who had lost way while hiking in Sanyari forest.
The suspects identified as Furqan and Abrar had allegedly harassed the three women, who were from Turkey, Italy and Norway.
The Islamabad police had formed special teams to arrest suspects involved in harassing three foreigners near Sanyari village in the precincts of Kohsar police station.
The women had told the police that they had gone for hiking in the Sanyari forest and strayed.
Some three suspects reached there and harassed them.

title: Husband kills wife, throws body into canal
text:
SHEIKHUPURA: A man allegedly shot his wife dead and later threw the body into a canal near Narang Mandi, some 75 kilometres from here.

Abid and Muqaddas, residents of Dera Iftikhar near Narang Mandi, had got married of their own free will some time ago and started living separately. However, the couple developed differences soon and often engaged in arguments.

On Saturday night, the couple got into an argument again. Abid shot at Muqaddas in fury and later threw her body into a canal.

Locals spotted the body and called Rescue 1122 whose rescuers reached the spot the recovered it and sent it for autopsy.

Abid had fled from the scene after allegedly committing the crime.

Published in Dawn, September 28th, 2020
summary:
SHEIKHUPURA: A man allegedly shot his wife dead and later threw the body into a canal near Narang Mandi, some 75 kilometres from here.
Abid and Muqaddas, residents of Dera Iftikhar near Narang Mandi, had got married of their own free will some time ago and started living separately.
However, the couple developed differences soon and often engaged in arguments.
Abid shot at Muqaddas in fury and later threw her body into a canal.
Locals spotted the body and called Rescue 1122 whose rescuers reached the spot the recovered it and sent it for autopsy.

title: 8-year-old boy raped, brutally killed in Balochistan's Kalat
text:
The body of an eight-year-old boy, who was sexually assaulted and brutally tortured before being killed, was found in Balochistan's Kalat district on Tuesday, officials and relatives said.

The minor boy had gone to his madressah near his home on Monday but went missing around 4:30pm when it was time for him to return home, according to Zahoor Ahmed, a relative of the child.

The family reported the child missing and searched for him along with police through the night, to no avail.

At 9am on Tuesday, police informed the family that the minor boy's body was found from a hill near Kalat. The body was brought to Quetta for autopsy.

Dr Ayesha, a police surgeon, while speaking to Dawn confirmed that the child had been raped "by more than one person". She said his skull had been fractured due to being hit by a stone.

Samples collected during the post-mortem examination will be sent to Lahore and their result will be received in a week's time, the doctor added.

Balochistan government spokesperson Liaquat Shahwani condemned the incident, saying he was "concerned at the increase in incidents of sexual violence".

Shahwani said a case had been registered of the incident at the concerned police station and nine suspects had been arrested.

According to a spokesperson for the regional office of the Ministry of Human Rights, more than 40 cases of child abuse have been reported in Balochistan so far this year.

Earlier this month, the body of an eight-year-old boy who was murdered after allegedly being raped was found hanging from a tree in Balochistan's Killa Abdullah district.

In August, a report by the NGO Sahil had revealed that as many as 1,489 children, at least eight per day, were sexually abused in the first half of the ongoing year in the country. The victims included 785 girls and 704 boys.

The abusers were acquaintances of the victims or victims’ families in 822 cases while strangers were involved in 135 reported cases, according to the report titled 'Cruel Numbers'.

The report said that in 98 cases, the victims were between the age of one to five years; in 331 cases, they were between six and 10 years of age; while the largest number of cases (490) involved victims between 11 to 15 years of age.
authors: ['Ghalib Nihad', 'Raja Raman', 'Ali Mehdi', 'Zeeshan Ahmed', 'Abdur R. Talukder', 'Andher Nagri', 'Rabia Hussain', 'Khurram Abbas', 'Asif', 'A. Shah']

The family reported the child missing and searched for him along with police through the night, to no avail.
At 9am on Tuesday, police informed the family that the minor boy's body was found from a hill near Kalat.
Earlier this month, the body of an eight-year-old boy who was murdered after allegedly being raped was found hanging from a tree in Balochistan's Killa Abdullah district.
The abusers were acquaintances of the victims or victims’ families in 822 cases while strangers were involved in 135 reported cases, according to the report titled 'Cruel Numbers'.

title: Girl gang-raped by ‘landlord’s son, servant’
text:
SARGODHA: A minor girl was gang-raped allegedly by a son of a landlord and his servant in the area of Chak 36-NB, about 20km from here on Monday.

As per police report, the nine-year-old girl along with her younger brother was grazing cattle in the fields when an unidentified young man, son of a landlord, raped her while his servant (identified in the report) stood guard.

The FIR was registered by Saddar Police under Section 376 PPC.

The father of the victim girl told the media that his minor daughter was gang-raped by both the suspects and her condition was critical.

He alleged that police did not register a case of gang-rape and they did not include the name of son of the landlord and nominated only his servant. He said police forced him to sign a blank paper.

When newsmen asked him to identify the son of the landlord, he said his family were received threats from the landlord’s family. He said he would identify the other suspect if he was given security.

Investigating officer Sub-Inspector Akhtar Hiussain refuted the allegations of the girl’s father, saying that both the suspects would be arrested after the statement of the girl and if the reports of medical ad DNA tests showed it as a gang-rape case. He said police were not favouring anybody.

Published in Dawn, November 11th, 2020
authors: ["The Newspaper'S Correspondent", 'Rana Sohail', 'Maliha Rehman', 'Images Staff', 'Maleeha Lodhi']
summary:
SARGODHA: A minor girl was gang-raped allegedly by a son of a landlord and his servant in the area of Chak 36-NB, about 20km from here on Monday.
As per police report, the nine-year-old girl along with her younger brother was grazing cattle in the fields when an unidentified young man, son of a landlord, raped her while his servant (identified in the report) stood guard.
The father of the victim girl told the media that his minor daughter was gang-raped by both the suspects and her condition was critical.
He alleged that police did not register a case of gang-rape and they did not include the name of son of the landlord and nominated only his servant.
When newsmen asked him to identify the son of the landlord, he said his family were received threats from the landlord’s family.

title: Woman ‘gang-raped’ in Okara
text:
A woman was allegedly gang-raped in the jurisdiction of Chauchak police station, Okara.

Police arrested two suspects in the incident on Saturday and sent them to jail while raids continued to arrest the other accused. As per details, the victim was going to the fields when she was sexually assaulted by two men. Moreover, two accomplices of the accused rapists also kept a watch while the incident took place.

According to police records, the victim, a resident of a village on the outskirts of Okara, had gone to the fields when the accused Shahid, Ramzan, Rizwan and Imran followed her.

The accused reportedly entered the fields with arms and sticks and the accused Shahid and Ramzan gang-raped the woman while his other co-accused kept guard.

The accused also continued to torture the woman during the rape. However, the victim made noise, which caught the attention of the nearby people.

Residents of the area gathered due to which the accused fled the scene. A case was registered by Chauchak police against the alleged rapists.

Upon receiving information, Punjab Inspector General of Police (IGP) Inam Ghani took notice of the incident and sought a reply from District Police Officer (DPO) Faisal Shehzad and the regional police officer.

The DPO directed the Chauchak police team to immediately arrest all the culprits of the incident.

Police shifted the victim to a hospital for medical examination where her laboratory test samples had also been sent to Lahore. The DPO said that action would be taken against all the accused involved in the incident as per the law. Incidents of gang-rape are rampant across the province.

On October 2, a woman was allegedly gang-raped in the provincial capital.

The victim was called in by the two suspects Hassan and Irfan for a job interview. When she reached the designated location, they took her to a hotel near Lahore Railway Station.

The suspects subjected her to sexual violence at said hotel.

On October 1, a woman was allegedly gang-raped by six people in Morkhanda area of Sheikhupura.

(The victims’ identities have not been disclosed as a matter of policy)

Published in The Express Tribune, November 8th, 2020.
summary:
A woman was allegedly gang-raped in the jurisdiction of Chauchak police station, Okara.
Moreover, two accomplices of the accused rapists also kept a watch while the incident took place.
The accused reportedly entered the fields with arms and sticks and the accused Shahid and Ramzan gang-raped the woman while his other co-accused kept guard.
On October 2, a woman was allegedly gang-raped in the provincial capital.
On October 1, a woman was allegedly gang-raped by six people in Morkhanda area of Sheikhupura.

title: Two Jamshoro men arrested for trying to rape teenager
text:
Two men were arrested in Jamshoro’s Bhan town for trying to rape a teenage girl on Thursday.

The Bhan Saeedabad police conducted a raid in Bhan’s Shaikh neighbourhood on the orders of Jamshoro SSP Mohammad Anwar Khetran and arrested two suspects.

A Matric student said on Wednesday that three men tried to rape her by dragging her into a deserted house while she was on her way to school. She complained that all three men had been harassing her for the past two years and were pressuring her to be their “friend”.

“On my repeated refusal they took me to a deserted place and tried to rape me but people heard me screaming and saved me,” she told local journalists.

She said the men had made her life miserable and she was considering quitting school because she was scared of being raped by them.

The Bhan Saeedabad police have registered an FIR on the young woman’s mother’s complaint. The two men they have arrested have been identified as Ali Raza and Shabir Mallah. The third man involved, Aijaz, has not been arrested yet.

SSP Khetran told the media on Thursday that he had ordered the local police to support the student and her family and arrest the men involved as soon as possible.
summary:
Two men were arrested in Jamshoro’s Bhan town for trying to rape a teenage girl on Thursday.
The Bhan Saeedabad police conducted a raid in Bhan’s Shaikh neighbourhood on the orders of Jamshoro SSP Mohammad Anwar Khetran and arrested two suspects.
A Matric student said on Wednesday that three men tried to rape her by dragging her into a deserted house while she was on her way to school.
The Bhan Saeedabad police have registered an FIR on the young woman’s mother’s complaint.
The two men they have arrested have been identified as Ali Raza and Shabir Mallah.

title: Woman ‘gang-raped’ by robbers in family’s presence in Punjab
text:
SARGODHA: Four armed men allegedly gang-raped a woman in presence of her children and husband and robbed the family of gold ornaments and Rs20,000 cash at village Ghula in the area of the Midh Ranjha police.

The complaint said four robbers, one of them identified, scaled the wall of his house in Dera Aslam Haral, took him, his wife and children to the roof and gang-raped his wife.

He alleged that the robbers took away cash and gold ornaments and raped his wife, once again, in the garden before fleeing.

He alleged that he had reported the matter to the police but they insisted on omitting the gang-rape allegation from the report.

However, after a passage of 12 hours, the police registered the case against two suspects, including the nominated one.

The police spokesman denied the allegations against the police station, saying the FIR had been registered on the written complaint of the complainant and investigating had been launched into the case.

District Police Officer Faisal Gulzar took notice of this incident and directed the SDPO Kot Momin to personally supervise the investigation.

In another incident, the robbers took away gold ornaments worth millions of rupees from a shop of goldsmith in Sarafa Bazaar of Bhalwal. Police have registered a case.

Published in Dawn, September 21st, 2020
authors: ["The Newspaper'S Correspondent", 'Asim Malik', 'Sharjeel Syed', 'Chrís Dăń', 'Raja Raman', 'Saif Zulfiqar', 'Azam', 'Dr No', 'Dr. Salaria', 'Aamir Ahmad']
summary:
SARGODHA: Four armed men allegedly gang-raped a woman in presence of her children and husband and robbed the family of gold ornaments and Rs20,000 cash at village Ghula in the area of the Midh Ranjha police.
The complaint said four robbers, one of them identified, scaled the wall of his house in Dera Aslam Haral, took him, his wife and children to the roof and gang-raped his wife.
He alleged that the robbers took away cash and gold ornaments and raped his wife, once again, in the garden before fleeing.
District Police Officer Faisal Gulzar took notice of this incident and directed the SDPO Kot Momin to personally supervise the investigation.
In another incident, the robbers took away gold ornaments worth millions of rupees from a shop of goldsmith in Sarafa Bazaar of Bhalwal.

title: Two cousins held on charge of raping girl
text:
MUZAFFARABAD: Police have apprehended two cousins accused of separately raping a 10-year-old orphan girl from their kin, officials said on Tuesday.

The crime occurred in Kaneri Langla village of Jhelum Valley district, about 55 km south of the AJK capital, reportedly over two weeks ago. It was “settled” by a local Jirga which imposed a punishment on the suspects, primarily in cash and in default of payment banishment from the village, said Raja Ansar Sajjad, the station house officer (SHO) of Hattian Bala.

“When we came to know about the offence from local sources, we sent a police team to the village to ascertain the facts,” he said, adding the team returned with the victim and her elder sister for their statements.

According to their statements, two sons of their stepbrothers had separately raped the girl at least four times.

According to the SHO, one of the suspects was married and in his mid-20s while the other was 18-year-old.

The medical examination of the girl conducted by a doctor at a Hattian Bala hospital the same evening confirmed the commission of rape following which an FIR was registered under section 10 of Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hudood) Act 1985.

In the meanwhile, those who were part of the Jirga were also summoned to the police station and asked to produce the suspects or else they would be arrested, he said.

The Jirga members, he said, had imposed a fine of Rs200,000 each on the suspects, failing which they had to expatriate themselves to some other areas.

The SHO assumed that since both were unable to pay the penalty and also feared strong reaction from the public and police, they fled to Mirpur and Rawalakot.

Riyaz Mughal, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Jhelum Valley, told reporters that eventually police arrested both the suspects within 24 hours.

He said one of the suspects had been shifted to Hattian Bala and produced before a magistrate for physical remand on Tuesday while the other suspect would be produced before the magistrate on Wednesday, he said.

Published in Dawn, September 23rd, 2020
summary:
MUZAFFARABAD: Police have apprehended two cousins accused of separately raping a 10-year-old orphan girl from their kin, officials said on Tuesday.
The crime occurred in Kaneri Langla village of Jhelum Valley district, about 55 km south of the AJK capital, reportedly over two weeks ago.
According to their statements, two sons of their stepbrothers had separately raped the girl at least four times.
According to the SHO, one of the suspects was married and in his mid-20s while the other was 18-year-old.
Riyaz Mughal, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Jhelum Valley, told reporters that eventually police arrested both the suspects within 24 hours.

title: Two minor girls raped
text:
SHEIKHUPURA: Two minor girls were allegedly raped in different parts of the district on Saturday.

The first incident took place in Rehman Garden locality in the area of Factory Area police .

The victim girl, the daughter of a labourer, was going to her home from the market when a man and his accomplice took her to an outhouse and gang-raped her before making an escape. Some passers-by, after hearing the victim’s cries, took her to her home.

The second incident occurred at village Bhekhi where a 10-year-old girl was raped by her neighbour.

The daughter of a labourer was alone at her home when the rapist scaled the wall to enter the house and raped the girl at gunpoint. Police, on report of the victim’s father, have started a probe.

Published in Dawn, September 21st, 2020
summary:
SHEIKHUPURA: Two minor girls were allegedly raped in different parts of the district on Saturday.
The first incident took place in Rehman Garden locality in the area of Factory Area police .
Some passers-by, after hearing the victim’s cries, took her to her home.
The second incident occurred at village Bhekhi where a 10-year-old girl was raped by her neighbour.
The daughter of a labourer was alone at her home when the rapist scaled the wall to enter the house and raped the girl at gunpoint.

title: Woman seeks action against alleged rapist of daughter
text:
BAHAWALNAGAR: A woman from Mcleod Ganj has demanded action against the alleged rapist of her teenage daughter.

The woman from Chak Saropa said a Mcleod Ganj Rural Health Centre official with his accomplice allegedly raped her daughter in the RHC on Aug 13. She alleged that after the incident, the influentials family members of the culprits and local panchait pressurized her to marry off her daughter with the alleged rapist.

According to police sources, the McLeod Ganj police came to know about the case when police visited the Mcleod Ganj RHC to investigate another case on August16. Sources said the police asked for the CCTV footage of the incident in writing.

When contacted, the McLeod Ganj police officials said they had received a written complaint from the complainant and action has been initiated on it.

The Mcleod Ganj RHC in charge said the police contacted them for the footage 15 days after the incident but the limit to save the CCTV footage had expired by then.

Published in Dawn, October 18th, 2020
summary:
BAHAWALNAGAR: A woman from Mcleod Ganj has demanded action against the alleged rapist of her teenage daughter.
The woman from Chak Saropa said a Mcleod Ganj Rural Health Centre official with his accomplice allegedly raped her daughter in the RHC on Aug 13.
She alleged that after the incident, the influentials family members of the culprits and local panchait pressurized her to marry off her daughter with the alleged rapist.
According to police sources, the McLeod Ganj police came to know about the case when police visited the Mcleod Ganj RHC to investigate another case on August16.
When contacted, the McLeod Ganj police officials said they had received a written complaint from the complainant and action has been initiated on it.

title: Three booked for assaulting transgender person
text:
Police registered a case against three armed men who allegedly abducted and physically assaulted a transgender person on Nadwala Road.

Police said the suspects, after abducting the victims, cut off the hair and snatched cash, a mobile phone among other valuables.

Police started raids to arrest the accused.

The case registered by a transgender gender person, a resident of Chak No 217, Rub Chakera. She complained that she had gone to Nadwala bungalow for some work.

On her way back, she was abducted at gunpoint by Shahid Imran, a resident Mandi Bahauddin, Zahid Irfan and Muhammad Yar, a resident of Sargodha.

The suspects took the victim to a crop field near Manda Pind and beat her.

They snatched 1.5 tola of gold jewelry, earrings, Rs18,000 cash and a mobile phone.

The suspect also cut her hair off and when she shouted at them for the heinous crime, they beat her. The accused then fled from the crime scene.

Police registered a case against the accused under Sections 337 V-382/34 and started searching for them.

Published in The Express Tribune, November 18th, 2020.
summary:
Police registered a case against three armed men who allegedly abducted and physically assaulted a transgender person on Nadwala Road.
Police said the suspects, after abducting the victims, cut off the hair and snatched cash, a mobile phone among other valuables.
The case registered by a transgender gender person, a resident of Chak No 217, Rub Chakera.
The suspect also cut her hair off and when she shouted at them for the heinous crime, they beat her.
Police registered a case against the accused under Sections 337 V-382/34 and started searching for them.

title: 12-year-old girl allegedly raped by ‘influential person’ in Bahawalpur
text:
BAHAWALPUR: In yet another rape incident, a 12-year-old girl was reportedly subjected to sexual assault at gunpoint by an ‘influential’ person inside her house in Bahawalpur on Sunday, ARY News reported.

According to the details, the ‘influential’ person along with his accomplices broke into a house in Bahawal Wah and tortured the family members and raped the girl.

On being informed of the incident, police and rescue officials rushed to the area and shifted the rape victim to the hospital.

The victim’s mother said that Khalid had raped her daughter at gunpoint inside her house. The incident sparked outrage among the locals.

The victim’s family staged a protest demonstration and demanded of the government to provide them with justice.

Read More: Girl returning from marriage ceremony ‘gang-raped’ in Bahawalpur

Earlier today, a girl had been allegedly gang-raped by three people in Bahawalpur district of the Punjab province as she was returning after attending a marriage ceremony.

The victim, a resident of Chak 7 BC in Bahawalpur, had claimed in a complaint filed with the local police that she was on her way home after attending a marriage ceremony when the accused abducted her.

“Three people raped me and further threatened to kill me on informing police regarding the incident,” the girl had said.

title: Bahawalpur woman raped by friend’s brother: police
text:
A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her friend’s brother in Bahawalpur, the police said on Monday.

According to the woman, she had gone to her friend’s house. The suspect had offered to drop her back home but instead took her to the nearby fields and raped her.

“He also took her bag, cash and the jewellery she was wearing,” the FIR said. The perpetrator, identified as Rafiq, managed to escape from the crime scene.

An FIR has been registered. The police said that they are waiting for the medical reports of the survivors. “We are conducting raids to arrest the suspect as soon as possible,” an officer remarked.
summary:
A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her friend’s brother in Bahawalpur, the police said on Monday.
According to the woman, she had gone to her friend’s house.
The suspect had offered to drop her back home but instead took her to the nearby fields and raped her.
“He also took her bag, cash and the jewellery she was wearing,” the FIR said.
“We are conducting raids to arrest the suspect as soon as possible,” an officer remarked.

title: Woman set ablaze by in-laws succumbs to her burns
text:
SIALKOT: A mother of five who was set ablaze after brutal torture by her husband and in-laws at Kung Phalora village of Pasrur tehsil a week ago, succumbed to her burns at the Jinnah Hospital Lahore on Saturday.

According to police sources, Shazia Bibi was married to Rana Firdous of Kung Phalora village of Pasrur tehsil some 15 years ago.

Soon after the marriage, Shazia’s husband and her in-laws started subjecting her to brutal physical torture for not bringing the dowry items they had demanded from her parents. During the period, the couple had five children.

According to the FIR, on Sept 27, Shazia’s husband, mother-in-law Khursheed Bibi, father-in-law Bashir and others brutally tortured her when she demanded meal for herself and her minor children.

It said the suspects then set her ablaze after dowsing her with petrol.

She was taken to the Government Allama Iqbal Memorial Teaching Hospital, Sialkot, with 95 per cent of her body burnt where doctors referred her to the Jinnah Hospital because of her critical condition.

She fought for life for a week at the Jinnah Hospital Lahore where she succumbed to her burns.

Phalora police handed over her dead body to grieved family after autopsy.

She was buried in the graveyard of her native village Kartarpur in Zafarwal tehsil.

On the report of the victim’s brother Shehzad, the police have registered a case against her in-laws.

Local police officials claimed they have arrested the victim’s mother-in-law and father-in-law and started investigation.

Published in Dawn, October 4th, 2020
authors: ["The Newspaper'S Correspondent", 'Surendra Sukhtankar', 'Azam', 'Naeem Qureshi', 'Maliha Rehman', 'Maleeha Lodhi']
summary:
SIALKOT: A mother of five who was set ablaze after brutal torture by her husband and in-laws at Kung Phalora village of Pasrur tehsil a week ago, succumbed to her burns at the Jinnah Hospital Lahore on Saturday.
According to police sources, Shazia Bibi was married to Rana Firdous of Kung Phalora village of Pasrur tehsil some 15 years ago.

She fought for life for a week at the Jinnah Hospital Lahore where she succumbed to her burns.

title: Minor girl raped in Mansehra; protesters call for hanging
text:
MANSEHRA: The residents of a village near here have thrown out an entire family, along with their belongings, after one of its members allegedly raped a minor girl, sources said on Wednesday.

Police have deployed a heavy contingent to the village to maintain law and order there.

According to the FIR lodged with the city police station, the suspect, who is said to be the father of several children, tricked the young victim and took her to some agriculture fields where he assaulted her.

The suspect’s brother told reporters that his family had handed over his brother to police. “If my brother is involved in such a heinous crime, we will not back him at any platform. Let the court decide his fate,” he said.

Police, however, did not confirm the suspect’s arrest.

Meanwhile, students of various schools and colleges mounted a protest against the assault on the four-year-old girl and called for public hanging of the suspect.

Enraged by rape of the minor girl, students took out a procession from Abbotta­bad road to Khatm-i-Nubu­wat chowk where a demonstration was held that was addressed by student leaders.

Speaking to the audience, one of them said the government should deal with an “iron hand” all the cases involving rape of women and assault on children which were increasing by the day.

He was of the opinion that the government should ens­ure that the affected family got justice as soon as possible and the culprit was hanged publicly so that he became an example for others.

“We cannot allow such gruesome incidents in our society where the father of many children assaults a four-year-old girl,” said another student leader.

Published in Dawn, September 24th, 2020
authors: ["The Newspaper'S Correspondent", 'Viq Saad', 'Chrís Dăń', 'Azam', 'Dr. Salaria', 'Aamir Ahmad', 'Maleeha Lodhi']
summary:
MANSEHRA: The residents of a village near here have thrown out an entire family, along with their belongings, after one of its members allegedly raped a minor girl, sources said on Wednesday.
The suspect’s brother told reporters that his family had handed over his brother to police.
Meanwhile, students of various schools and colleges mounted a protest against the assault on the four-year-old girl and called for public hanging of the suspect.
Enraged by rape of the minor girl, students took out a procession from Abbotta­bad road to Khatm-i-Nubu­wat chowk where a demonstration was held that was addressed by student leaders.
“We cannot allow such gruesome incidents in our society where the father of many children assaults a four-year-old girl,” said another student leader.

title: Transgender person killed by brother in Swabi
text:
SWABI: A transgender person was gunned down by his younger brother here on Friday.

Saad Khan, who belonged to Swabi city, had gone to Rawalpindi and Islamabad where he participated in several dance parties.

His family was opposed to his dance performance and his brother had warned him of dire consequences.

Mohammad Hamad, a 13-year-old brother of the transgender person, scuffled with Saad when he returned home. He took a weapon and shot Saad dead.

Mir Sultan, another brother of the deceased transgender person, lodged an FIR against Hamad, SHO Farooq Khan said.

According to police, the inspector general of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa police took notice of the incident and directed the district police to arrest the killer and provide adequate security to other transgender persons in Swabi.

District Police Officer Imran Shahid said a special team led by SP investigation Banaras Khan had been constituted and he would personally supervise the investigation.

The body of the deceased was shifted to Bacha Khan Medical Complex, Shahmansoor, for autopsy.

SP Banaras Khan later said at a press conference that police had arrested Hamad and seized the pistol he had used to kill his brother. “The incident was not that of a targeted killing,” he added.

Published in Dawn, September 12th, 2020
summary:
SWABI: A transgender person was gunned down by his younger brother here on Friday.
Saad Khan, who belonged to Swabi city, had gone to Rawalpindi and Islamabad where he participated in several dance parties.
His family was opposed to his dance performance and his brother had warned him of dire consequences.
Mohammad Hamad, a 13-year-old brother of the transgender person, scuffled with Saad when he returned home.
Mir Sultan, another brother of the deceased transgender person, lodged an FIR against Hamad, SHO Farooq Khan said.

title: Theatre owner among eight booked for rape bid on actress
text:
SAHIWAL: Ghala Mandi police registered a case against the owner of a commercial theatre, his younger brother and six others for making a rape attempt on the Lahore-based stage actress and torturing her.

The actress had demanded justice from the authorities by posting a video clip on social media on Sunday evening.

District Police Officer Malik Amir Taimoor took notice of the incident after the video clip went viral.

In the first information report (FIR), the actress said she was in Sahiwal for a theatre performance at the Marian Commercial Theatre, on the Sahiwal-Multan road. She was staying in one of the rooms on the theatre premises.

During the afternoon, the theatre owner and his younger knocked at her door and demanded sexual favours for their Dubai-based friends.

On her refusal, the suspects, including the theatre owner, whipped out pistols and tried to force her to accept their demand. They called in their security guards also and all the men abused and physically tortured her.

She alleged the attackers tore off her clothes and tried to rape her. She locked herself in the room and somehow managed to make calls for help.

Ghala Mandi Station House Officer Allah Ditta Shaheen confirmed that a case had been registered against two idetified and six unidentified men under sections 376 and 511 of PPC after seeking a medical report from the Sahiwal DHQ Teaching Hospital.

SHO Shaheen said the police were trying to arrest the suspects.

ELECTION: The Democratic Ittehad Group defeated Founder Group in the annual election of the Sahiwal Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

There were total 258 and 1,165 registered voters in corporate and executive categories, respectively.

Asif Iqbal, Qasir Sardar Rammay, Shaikh Basharat Azmat and Haroon Rasheed won on corporate seats while Abdul Haseeb, Sardar Zafar Ghumman, Muhammad Afzal Kashif and Muhammad Asim won executive seats.

Published in Dawn, September 23rd, 2020
summary:
SAHIWAL: Ghala Mandi police registered a case against the owner of a commercial theatre, his younger brother and six others for making a rape attempt on the Lahore-based stage actress and torturing her.
The actress had demanded justice from the authorities by posting a video clip on social media on Sunday evening.
In the first information report (FIR), the actress said she was in Sahiwal for a theatre performance at the Marian Commercial Theatre, on the Sahiwal-Multan road.
During the afternoon, the theatre owner and his younger knocked at her door and demanded sexual favours for their Dubai-based friends.
On her refusal, the suspects, including the theatre owner, whipped out pistols and tried to force her to accept their demand.

title: Pakistan: Body found after torture and rape of two-year-old from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa’s Charsadda
text:
Zainab Image Credit: Twitter

A two-year-old girl’s body was found after she was sexually assaulted and tortured in the province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa in Pakistan on October 7. Social media users shared the hashtag #AnotherZainab to shed light on the cases of violence against women and girls in the country.

Residents and police said the minor girl, Zainab, had gone missing in the evening of October 6 in the Sheikh Kallay Qilla area of her hometown, Charsadda, while playing with a group of children outside her house.

On Wednesday, the police got information about the body of the girl lying in Peshawar’s Jabba Korona area. Cops recovered the body and shifted it to the Lady Reading Hospital in Peshawar for a post-mortem, according to local media reports.

District Police Officer (DPO) in the Charsadda locality, Mohammad Shoaib Khan, said that police had initially registered a First Information Report (FIR), against unknown kidnappers on the complaint of the girl's father. According to local media reports, eight suspects have been arrested so far in the case.

Khan said that initial investigation "suggests that the minor was assaulted before her murder", adding that there were torture marks on the girl's body. Police are waiting for a medical report to confirm more details.

According to a news report, Zainab's father demanded that the government catches the culprits as soon as possible and provides justice to the family.

"Today it is my Zainab, tomorrow another Zainab could suffer this," he was quoted as saying.

Netizens demand #JusticeforZainab

Social media users shared the hashtags #JusticeforZainab and #AnotherZainab as they expressed outrage over the incident.

Twitter user @S_H_Gillani wrote: “Another Day. Another Tragedy. Another incident. Another Rape! But the question here is till when? How to stop this? Where is the state? How many more Zainabs have to face the brutal rapists? #JusticeForZainab”

Tweep @Yeh_tu_hoga wrote about a recent rape case that happened in Lahore, which caused outrage across the country: “Motorway case remains unsolved while more and more horrifying cases of sexual assault are being reported. But yeah ban games and [television series] first because that's how judiciary system of Pakistan works. I am not even surprised honestly, disgusted to the core. #JusticeForZainab”





Photos of the two-year-old's body circulated on social media with many users comparing the incident to the 2018 rape and murder of eight-year-old Zainab Amin in Kasur city.
summary:
Zainab Image Credit: TwitterA two-year-old girl’s body was found after she was sexually assaulted and tortured in the province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa in Pakistan on October 7.
Social media users shared the hashtag #AnotherZainab to shed light on the cases of violence against women and girls in the country.
Khan said that initial investigation "suggests that the minor was assaulted before her murder", adding that there were torture marks on the girl's body.
According to a news report, Zainab's father demanded that the government catches the culprits as soon as possible and provides justice to the family.
Netizens demand #JusticeforZainabSocial media users shared the hashtags #JusticeforZainab and #AnotherZainab as they expressed outrage over the incident.

title: Woman gang raped in front of husband in Toba Tek Singh
text:
A woman was gang-raped by two unidentified men at gunpoint on her way home from Faisalabad to Toba Tek Singh, the police said on Sunday.

According to the survivor’s statement to the police, she was stopped by two men near Toba Tek Sindh’s Chak 99. She was with her husband at the time.

“The men were armed. They forced the couple to get out of the car, took all their valuables and then raped the woman,” a police officer said, adding that they then fled from the crime scene.

Her husband said that the suspects threatened to kill them if they complained to the police. “I asked people passing by for help but they stopped us from calling the police after which I called my brother to save us.”

A case has been registered. The police said that a medical test of the survivor will also be conducted.

The family, on the other hand, has requested Punjab Chief Minister Usman Buzdar to take notice of the crime and arrest the perpetrators as soon as possible.
summary:
A woman was gang-raped by two unidentified men at gunpoint on her way home from Faisalabad to Toba Tek Singh, the police said on Sunday.
According to the survivor’s statement to the police, she was stopped by two men near Toba Tek Sindh’s Chak 99.
They forced the couple to get out of the car, took all their valuables and then raped the woman,” a police officer said, adding that they then fled from the crime scene.
Her husband said that the suspects threatened to kill them if they complained to the police.
The family, on the other hand, has requested Punjab Chief Minister Usman Buzdar to take notice of the crime and arrest the perpetrators as soon as possible.

title: Woman and uncle shot at, injured by husband
text:
HAFIZABAD, Oct 13 (APP):A young woman and her uncle were shot at and injured by her husband here on Tuesday.

According to rescue-1122, Sonia Bibi (22) had contracted love marriage with Rana Imran of Mohallah Kashmir Nagar a year ago but their relations strained on one pretext or the other and she decided to get divorce from him.

Sonia Bibi along with her Uncle Zafar Ali (65) was returning from civil courts after filing divorce suit against her husband when her husband allegedly opened fire at them near Gala Qazianwala, Hafizabad.

They received critical bullet injuries. The Rescue-1122 shifted the injured to the Trauma Centre Hafizabad from where they were referred to Lahore hospital in precarious condition. City police have registered a case against the accused.

Stay tuned to Baaghi TV for latest news and updates!
summary:
HAFIZABAD, Oct 13 (APP):A young woman and her uncle were shot at and injured by her husband here on Tuesday.
Sonia Bibi along with her Uncle Zafar Ali (65) was returning from civil courts after filing divorce suit against her husband when her husband allegedly opened fire at them near Gala Qazianwala, Hafizabad.
The Rescue-1122 shifted the injured to the Trauma Centre Hafizabad from where they were referred to Lahore hospital in precarious condition.
City police have registered a case against the accused.
Stay tuned to Baaghi TV for latest news and updates!

title: Two women, minor allegedly raped in Faisalabad
text:
Two women as well as a minor boy were allegedly sexually assaulted in the district on Friday. Police said that in a case filed by Shahzeb, a resident of Johar Colony Baseline, in Millat Town police station, it had been stated that his paternal aunt was travelling to Faisalabad from Sahiwal.

When she reached near Faisalabad from Lari Adda in a rickshaw, she lost her way and was unable to find her nephew’s house.

Meanwhile, taking advantage of the situation, the accused Muzammil Hussain, Raja and others, abducted the victim and took her to one the suspects’ house where they raped her.

The alleged rapists also looted Rs50,000 cash and clothes from the victim and ‘sent her back’ to Sahiwal from Lari Adda. The victim informed her family after she reached Sahiwal.

Millat Town police registered a case against the accused under Section 376TP.

Meanwhile, another woman was gang raped by the accused Arshad, Asif and Latif. The victim was alone in her house located in suburban village 73GB when the incident took place.

As per details available with The Express Tribune, this was the second time this victim was raped by the accused Arshad.

The alleged rapist had also raped the same victim around a year ago after which he was arrested. However, the accused was released from jail after certain witnesses reportedly gave a false testimony in the case of 766/19 crime 376 TP in Thikriwala police station.

Police registered a case against the three accused under Section 376TPP.

Moreover, an 11-year-old boy, the son of Muhammad Tahir was called by the accused Iftikhar to his farm in the suburban village 170GB. The accused then took the minor to Faisal Kamad area where he raped him.

Separately, in Chak No 383GB, Amjad Ali teenage daughter was sleeping alone in her house when the accused Ijaz and Jahan Khan barged into her residence and attempted to rape her. However, the victim resisted and screamed which caught the attention of nearby people.

Police registered a case under Section 376/511 and started searching for the accused. Cases of sexual assault have been on the rise in the district.

According to figures obtained by The Express Tribune, more than 300 cases of rape and 72 of attempted rape have been reported in the district during the past nine months.

On August 15, three victims including two minors and a teenage girl were raped by men in separate incidents in the city.

On June 7, the body of a seven-year-old boy was found by local residents and police claimed that the victim was abducted two days earlier from D-Type Colony and sexually assaulted. The body was reportedly thrown into a canal in Dijkot area. On May 23, a teenage girl was gang-raped by five men after being abducted in Landianwala area. As per details, on the night of the incident, an unknown armed man entered the victim’s house by climbing the wall, woke up the family at gunpoint and began searching their rooms.

He looted Rs50,000 cash and gold jewelry from a trunk and also abducted an 18-year-old girl on a motorcycle for sexually assaulting her.

(The victims’ identities have not been disclosed as a matter of policy)

Published in The Express Tribune, September 26th, 2020.
summary:
Two women as well as a minor boy were allegedly sexually assaulted in the district on Friday.
Meanwhile, taking advantage of the situation, the accused Muzammil Hussain, Raja and others, abducted the victim and took her to one the suspects’ house where they raped her.
As per details available with The Express Tribune, this was the second time this victim was raped by the accused Arshad.
The accused then took the minor to Faisal Kamad area where he raped him.
As per details, on the night of the incident, an unknown armed man entered the victim’s house by climbing the wall, woke up the family at gunpoint and began searching their rooms.

title: Two men booked for assault on minor
text:
KASUR: Two men were booked on Tuesday for allegedly sexually assaulting a four-year-old boy in village Bonga Balocha.

Police lodged a criminal case according to which two nominated suspects of the same village sexually abused a four-year-old boy on Sunday after taking him to the nearby fields. The suspects had then managed to escape.

Police registered a case and were making efforts to arrest the culprits.

Published in Dawn, October 14th, 2020
summary:
KASUR: Two men were booked on Tuesday for allegedly sexually assaulting a four-year-old boy in village Bonga Balocha.
Police lodged a criminal case according to which two nominated suspects of the same village sexually abused a four-year-old boy on Sunday after taking him to the nearby fields.
The suspects had then managed to escape.
Police registered a case and were making efforts to arrest the culprits.
Published in Dawn, October 14th, 2020

title: Two women murdered in Dadu over ‘marriage issue’
text:
Two women identified as Konj and Fouzia Chandio were shot dead in Gozo union council near Khairpur Nathan Shah in Dadu district on Sunday.

Police teams reached the scene to collect the bodies and have begun an investigation into the double murder.

According to the initial reports, both women were killed over a ‘matrimonial issue’.

Dadu SSP Farrukh Raza Malik told local journalists that he had directed police officials to thoroughly investigate the murders and and ensure the arrest of the killers.

On Saturday, a mother of two children, Ameera Jatoi, was shot dead allegedly her husband Ameer Ali Jatoi near Dadu. The woman was attacked while going to a local court to attend the hearing on her application to seek a divorce.
summary:
Two women identified as Konj and Fouzia Chandio were shot dead in Gozo union council near Khairpur Nathan Shah in Dadu district on Sunday.
According to the initial reports, both women were killed over a ‘matrimonial issue’.
Dadu SSP Farrukh Raza Malik told local journalists that he had directed police officials to thoroughly investigate the murders and and ensure the arrest of the killers.
On Saturday, a mother of two children, Ameera Jatoi, was shot dead allegedly her husband Ameer Ali Jatoi near Dadu.
The woman was attacked while going to a local court to attend the hearing on her application to seek a divorce.

title: Mother, daughter killed for ‘honour’ in South Punjab
text:
LAHORE: Marking another gender-based violence incident in the series of brutalities meted out to innocents, a mother and her daughter were killed on Monday in the name of ‘honour’, ARY News reported.

According to the details acquired, the beheaded bodies of two women, mother and daughter, were reportedly found in Zahir Pir, a city in Rahim Yar Khan district of South Punjab. The sources claimed the duo was murdered in the name of honour.

The local police have initiated case investigation and the bodies have been sent to the hospital for regular legal proceedings.

Police said they have begun probing the case while the suspect was still at large. While they were on the lookout for the suspect, they said post mortem report will further divulge key details into the incident.

READ: Man kills sister, relative over honour in Karachi

Earlier it was reported from Karachi wherein the police found two bodies in a house in Malir area.

According to the senior superintendent of police (SSP), the couple was murdered by the woman’s brother. The man, in police custody, confessed to killing them on the pretext of honour.

The two days old bodies were recovered from a house in Joharabad of Malir City over the identification of the accused. “The brother of the woman bought a knife from cattle market to kill the couple,” the SSP added.

The bodies identified as Sumera and Zahid Hassan were moved to a hospital for medico-legal.

Comments

comments
summary:
LAHORE: Marking another gender-based violence incident in the series of brutalities meted out to innocents, a mother and her daughter were killed on Monday in the name of ‘honour’, ARY News reported.
According to the details acquired, the beheaded bodies of two women, mother and daughter, were reportedly found in Zahir Pir, a city in Rahim Yar Khan district of South Punjab.
The local police have initiated case investigation and the bodies have been sent to the hospital for regular legal proceedings.
READ: Man kills sister, relative over honour in KarachiEarlier it was reported from Karachi wherein the police found two bodies in a house in Malir area.
The two days old bodies were recovered from a house in Joharabad of Malir City over the identification of the accused.

title: Lahore man murders wife for not signing over her property
text:
A man murdered his wife after she allegedly refused to give him money and land in Lahore, the police said on Thursday.

The police said the suspect tried to force his wife into signing over her property to him and giving him Rs2.5 million. But she refused. He tortured and killed her, the police said.

The incident took place in Kot Lakhpat.

The post-mortem indicated that she bore torture marks on her neck and head. The law enforcers said the woman had three children, two of whom she had dropped to school just before her murder.

Her husband and father-in-law have been taken into custody.
summary:
A man murdered his wife after she allegedly refused to give him money and land in Lahore, the police said on Thursday.
The police said the suspect tried to force his wife into signing over her property to him and giving him Rs2.5 million.
The post-mortem indicated that she bore torture marks on her neck and head.
The law enforcers said the woman had three children, two of whom she had dropped to school just before her murder.
Her husband and father-in-law have been taken into custody.

title: Woman poisoned, leg of another chopped off ‘by husbands’
text:
BAHAWALPUR: A woman was killed while another was brutally tortured allegedly by their respective husbands in separate incidents in the district on Tuesday.

The chief minister has taken notice of these incidents and directed the police to arrest the culprits.

In the Bismillah Colony, Shoaib alias Shabbi along with his three accomplices allegedly poisoned his newly-wed wife, Afsana Bibi, whom he had married 10 days ago of her own free will.

Afsana’s mother, Jannat Bibi, in her first information report (FIR) registered at the Civil Lines police station under sections 302 and 34 of the PPC alleged that right after the marriage, Shoaib had started to torture her daughter to get her share in the family property.

On finding out about the torture, she rushed to her daughter’s house and saw that Shoaib along with Shama Bibi, Sana Bibi and Zafar had administered poison to her daughter, who was lying on the floor in a precarious condition. On seeing her there, the suspects fled from the scene, Jannat alleged. She took her daughter to Bahawal Victoria Hospital (BVH) in a rickshaw, but she died on the way. No arrest was made till the filing of this report.

In the second incident, Javed Qadir allegedly tortured his wife Parveen and chopped off one of her legs with an axe near village 132/DNB.

According to the FIR registered under sections 334 and 34 of PPC against four people, Parveen had a family dispute with Qadir who used to torture her time and again. The suspect also took his wife’s chopped leg with him while fleeing. She was shifted to the THQ hospital where her condition was stated to be serious.

Chief Minister Usman Buzdar has taken notice of both the incidents and directed the local police officials to arrest the culprits.

IQBALIAT DEPT: The Islamia University (IUB) has decided to establish a department of ‘Iqbaliat’ on philosopher and poet Allama Iqbal.

This was announced by IUB Vice Chancellor (VC) Prof Dr Athar Mehboob at an event held at the Ghotvi Hall of the university’s Abbasia Campus on Monday night in connection with Iqbal’s 143rd birth anniversary.

The IUB has had a joint department of Urdu and Iqbaliat since its establishment. But after the VC’s announcement, the department would be bifurcated.

The VC, while paying homage to Allama Iqbal, said the poet’s personality, ideology, poetry and sayings were in fact precious national assets. An independent department of Iqbaliat was necessitated as his work needed a thorough research by knowledge-seekers of the university.

He added that Iqbal’s poetry carried an eternal message and for its dissemination the IUB would make efforts across the world.

Published in Dawn, November 11th, 2020
summary:
BAHAWALPUR: A woman was killed while another was brutally tortured allegedly by their respective husbands in separate incidents in the district on Tuesday.
In the second incident, Javed Qadir allegedly tortured his wife Parveen and chopped off one of her legs with an axe near village 132/DNB.
The suspect also took his wife’s chopped leg with him while fleeing.
IQBALIAT DEPT: The Islamia University (IUB) has decided to establish a department of ‘Iqbaliat’ on philosopher and poet Allama Iqbal.
An independent department of Iqbaliat was necessitated as his work needed a thorough research by knowledge-seekers of the university.

title: 16-year-old girl allegedly raped by landlord in Sargodha
text:
SARGODHA: Yet another rape case has been reported in Punjab, where a 16-year-old housemaid was allegedly raped by a landlord in Sargodha, ARY News reported on Tuesday.

﻿

According to the details, the incident happened in Melowall in the limits of PS Miani in Sargodha, where a housemaid was being repeatedly raped by the landlord from last 6 months.

The police have moved the girl to the hospital for her medical reports, while a case has been registered against the alleged rapist on the complaint of the brother of the girl.

Earlier on September 13, a 40-year-old man had allegedly raped his 17-year-old stepdaughter in Gujranwala’s Pasban Colony.

Read more: Teenage girl allegedly raped by stepfather in Gujranwala

According to the police, the teenage girl in her statement to the police had alleged that her stepfather, Gulzar, had raped her several times. A case had been registered against the suspect on a victim’s complaint.

Meanwhile, police had arrested the accused and started investigation. He will be interrogated further after the medical reports of the victim, the police had said. The 17-year-old girl had been shifted to the hospital for medical examination.

Comments

comments
summary:
SARGODHA: Yet another rape case has been reported in Punjab, where a 16-year-old housemaid was allegedly raped by a landlord in Sargodha, ARY News reported on Tuesday.
The police have moved the girl to the hospital for her medical reports, while a case has been registered against the alleged rapist on the complaint of the brother of the girl.
Earlier on September 13, a 40-year-old man had allegedly raped his 17-year-old stepdaughter in Gujranwala’s Pasban Colony.
Read more: Teenage girl allegedly raped by stepfather in GujranwalaAccording to the police, the teenage girl in her statement to the police had alleged that her stepfather, Gulzar, had raped her several times.
He will be interrogated further after the medical reports of the victim, the police had said.

title: Man arrested for attempting to rape child in Mithi
text:
A man, Anwar Bajeer, was arrested by the Mithi police on charges of attempting to sexually abuse a young boy in Fakeer Hussain village near Tharparkar’s Mithi town late Friday night.

The father of a nine-year-old boy told the police that the accused overpowered his son and dragged him to a deserted place in their village and tried to rape him. Other villagers heard his cries and rushed to his aid. They caught Bajeer.

The boy was sent to Civil Hospital, Mithi for a medical examination. Mithi SHO Majid Qaimkhani told local journalists on Saturday that after arresting the accused, the police registered an FIR against him under the Pakistan Penal Code.
summary:
A man, Anwar Bajeer, was arrested by the Mithi police on charges of attempting to sexually abuse a young boy in Fakeer Hussain village near Tharparkar’s Mithi town late Friday night.
The father of a nine-year-old boy told the police that the accused overpowered his son and dragged him to a deserted place in their village and tried to rape him.
Other villagers heard his cries and rushed to his aid.
The boy was sent to Civil Hospital, Mithi for a medical examination.
Mithi SHO Majid Qaimkhani told local journalists on Saturday that after arresting the accused, the police registered an FIR against him under the Pakistan Penal Code.

title: Man held for trying to sexually assault boy
text:
GUJAR KHAN: A man has been arrested by Rawat police for his alleged attempt to sexually assault a nine-year-old boy on Friday.

The boy’s father told the police that his son used to go to a mosque for offering prayers and learning Quran from the prayer leader.

On Friday evening, the prayer leader attempted to sexually assault the boy, he alleged.

Police arrested the suspect within a couple of hours after registration of a case.

SP Saddar Ziauddin Ahmed said strict action would be taken against those involved in heinous crime such as sexually assaulting women and children.

Published in Dawn, November 14th, 2020
summary:
GUJAR KHAN: A man has been arrested by Rawat police for his alleged attempt to sexually assault a nine-year-old boy on Friday.
The boy’s father told the police that his son used to go to a mosque for offering prayers and learning Quran from the prayer leader.
On Friday evening, the prayer leader attempted to sexually assault the boy, he alleged.
Police arrested the suspect within a couple of hours after registration of a case.
SP Saddar Ziauddin Ahmed said strict action would be taken against those involved in heinous crime such as sexually assaulting women and children.

title: Man shoots dead sister, man for ‘honour’
text:
DERA MURAD JAMALI: A brother allegedly shot dead his sister and a man in the name of honour in a village in Magsi Shakh area of Nasirabad district on Monday.

Police said Azmat Khan opened fire on his 18-year-old sister in Khan Kot village, killing her on the spot. Later, he shot dead Abdul Samad, 22, in the same village and fled the area.

Police reached the village and took the victims’ bodies to hospital. They have registered a case and are investigating the incident.

Published in Dawn, November 3rd, 2020
summary:
DERA MURAD JAMALI: A brother allegedly shot dead his sister and a man in the name of honour in a village in Magsi Shakh area of Nasirabad district on Monday.
Police said Azmat Khan opened fire on his 18-year-old sister in Khan Kot village, killing her on the spot.
Later, he shot dead Abdul Samad, 22, in the same village and fled the area.
Police reached the village and took the victims’ bodies to hospital.
They have registered a case and are investigating the incident.

title: Gang members held over rape
text:
OKARA: Sahiwal Regional Police Officer (RPO) Tariq Abbas Qureshi claims five people, out of seven or eight, who during a dacoity raped a woman in Adda Salowal near Dipalpur last month, were arrested on Saturday.

He told a press conference at Diplapur on Saturday that after a week the gang also looted valuables from two more houses at Pul Ghara near Hujra Shah Muqeem.

District Police Officer Faisal Shahzad was also present.

The RPO said some five weeks back, the gang of seven or eight people broke into a house for dacoity in Salowal situated at Dipalpur-Hujra Road where four criminals also gang-raped a woman. A week after this incident, the gunmen struck a house in Pul Ghara locality and deprived two houses of valuables.

They faced an encounter where a gunman, later identified as Akram, alias Ikram, of Nankana Sahib, was killed as the village men and police reached the scene when announced in the village mosques regarding incidents.

These nabbed gunmen were identified as Farooq, Gulzar Aman, Sheryar, alias Choha, Iqbal and Haider.

Nine police teams, led by SP Shamasul Haq Durrani, used the latest techniques beside the traditional police methods of investigation to arrest the gang.

The police recovered illegal weapons, motorcycles and cash from them.

Published in Dawn, October 25th, 2020
summary:
OKARA: Sahiwal Regional Police Officer (RPO) Tariq Abbas Qureshi claims five people, out of seven or eight, who during a dacoity raped a woman in Adda Salowal near Dipalpur last month, were arrested on Saturday.
He told a press conference at Diplapur on Saturday that after a week the gang also looted valuables from two more houses at Pul Ghara near Hujra Shah Muqeem.
The RPO said some five weeks back, the gang of seven or eight people broke into a house for dacoity in Salowal situated at Dipalpur-Hujra Road where four criminals also gang-raped a woman.
A week after this incident, the gunmen struck a house in Pul Ghara locality and deprived two houses of valuables.
Nine police teams, led by SP Shamasul Haq Durrani, used the latest techniques beside the traditional police methods of investigation to arrest the gang.

title: Man, friends gang rape university student in Chiniot: police
text:
A man has been arrested for raping a university student at his house in Chiniot, according to the police.

He and the woman used to take tuition classes together. The woman was studying at a university in Faisalabad.

The man had invited the woman, who hails from Larkana, to his house for a milaad function. She travelled with him and when they arrived at his home, he and three of his friends raped her.

The DPO said that the medical examination confirmed the rape.

The police are conducting raids for the arrest of the other suspects.

Pakistan’s rape laws

Rape is a punishable offence in Pakistan. The definition and punishment for this crime is detailed under Sections 375 and 376 of the Pakistan Penal Code.

According to the law, a man is said to commit rape when he has sexual intercourse with a woman under circumstances falling under any of the five following descriptions:

Against her will

Without her consent

With her consent, when the consent has been obtained by putting her in fear of death or of hurt

With her consent, when the man knows that he is not married to her and that the consent is given because she believes that the man is another person to whom she is or believes herself to be married; or

With or without her consent when she is under 16 years of age.

The convicted rapists will be sentenced to jail for no less than 10 years or more than 25 years, according to the law. A fine will also be imposed on them.
summary:
A man has been arrested for raping a university student at his house in Chiniot, according to the police.
The woman was studying at a university in Faisalabad.
The man had invited the woman, who hails from Larkana, to his house for a milaad function.
She travelled with him and when they arrived at his home, he and three of his friends raped her.
The convicted rapists will be sentenced to jail for no less than 10 years or more than 25 years, according to the law.
